intro: Gnaphalium schraderi, commonly known as the Schrader's feather grass, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and disturbed areas. Its slender, grass-like leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, feathery appearance. Gnaphalium schraderi produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
